column4: How do I install SNMP? I *think* I installed some kind of SNMPd but it doesn't seem to work :/
client or server?
i don't know any short tutorials, but the 'snmpconf' tool in the 'snmp' package might be a nice start
you can use the snmpwalk tool
and you have a running snmpd process?
and lsof -i | grep snmp shows a snmpd process bound to localhost?
that's ok
what happens if you telnet to port 161?
what was the exact snmpwalk command you tried?
hmm, thats smux... not needed for this
can you show me your com2sec lines in your /etc/snmpd.conf?
hmmm, fascinating
can you put your config on pastebin or something where I can see it?
ok i'll take a look
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/12696  <-- my 'working' snmpd.conf on one of my boxes
NET-SNMP version:  5.2.2
hmmm no, sorry
what kind of probs?
hmmm
doesn't ring a bell :(
yw
